events.comment: Switch to the game once all connections are confirmed [send from Broker]
This Connection Procedure is divided into steps since the dataflow is asynchronious. It also helps to debug and avoids the same P2P events triggered at the same time
recieve playerlist from the broker and store it into a global variable (for use in later scenes) [send from Broker]
Wait for the JSON to be stored and the variable playerdata is no longer n, then kick off the connection progress
Parse the JSON recieved from the broker and store it in the Global Variable playerlist
Wait for the JSON to be parsed and the variable playerlist is no longer n, then check your position in the list
we search for our position in the playerlist and set the PlayerCount variable to it,  since you only need to connect to the players above you in the playerlist
Continue connection progress, if not the last player
The last player in the list does not need to connect to anyone
connect to players with a higher position in the playerlist
Wait for the connect response
Wait for the confirm

events.name: Waiters actions for connecting issues (should not be needed, since the broker will send the "restart" if a peer disconnects)

events.comment: if the connection failed we skip the user for now and just add a fake +1 to PeerCount to be able to give the "ready" in step 5

SubStr(VariableString(error),33,68) returns the id of the failed connection (if variable error was set to P2P::GetLastError()), if the error massage was failed to connect to .........
depending on your game, you might want to trigger an event to the broker and tell him, that the connection failed  and either try to connect again, or remove him out of the playerlist
Check if it was the last player
if not, repeat connection progress
if yes, go out of the connection loop by setting step to 5
In this step we wait till all players are connected
When PeerCount (+ 1 for the broker) is equal to the number of children of playerlist means  all players are connected
Give the Broker the Ready!
Uptate the status text to let the player know
